message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CL

The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques, specifically artificial neural networks, to predict the future influence of scientific papers based on their citation counts. This topic falls under several sub-categories of computer science, including information retrieval (cs.IR), deep learning (cs.DL), machine learning (cs.LG), social and information networks (cs.SI), and computational linguistics (cs.CL). However, given the focus on citation analysis and bibliometrics, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.DL and cs.LG for the use of neural networks. The other two sub-categories, cs.SI and cs.CL, are less likely but still relevant due to the potential applications of the proposed method in analyzing social and information networks and text processing.
